briefdescription.para: Set the query to run asynchronously (ie: execute() does not block).

detaileddescription.para: Use callbacks or poll via isExecuting() to know when the query completes.

parameterdescription.para: If true, do not block on execute (default: false)

briefdescription.para: Return whether or not the query will run asynchronously.

simplesect.para: If the query will run asynchronously

briefdescription.para: Set the query to run persistently.

detaileddescription.para: A persistent query will be executed again if the database engine detects that an update or an insert has occured on the table queried by this object.
Usually, this is only useful with a callback. :)

parameterdescription.para: If true, register as a persistent query (default: false)

briefdescription.para: Return whether or not the query should run persistently.
Add a sbIDatabaseSimpleQueryCallback instance to the query.

parameterdescription.para: The callback instance

briefdescription.para: Remove a sbIDatabaseSimpleQueryCallback instance from the query.

parameterdescription.para: The callback instance

briefdescription.para: Set the database to be queried.

detaileddescription.para: This function associates the query object with a particular database.
The dbGUID parameter is any unique string used as a filename to create a queryable database sandbox.
The special character "*" may be passed to execute a query across all databases tracked by the application.

parameterdescription.para: The database identifier

briefdescription.para: Get the database identifier string.
Add a SQL query string to the queue.

detaileddescription.para: This method enqueues a string to be exectued as a SQL query.
See: http://www.sqlite.org/lang.html for supported query syntax.

parameterdescription.para: The query string

briefdescription.para: Return the number of query strings enqueued for execution.

simplesect.para: The number of query strings enqueued

briefdescription.para: Get the query string at the Nth index.

parameterdescription.para: The index into the queue

briefdescription.para: Clear out the query and make it all sparkly new.

detaileddescription.para: You *must* call this method if you want to reuse a query object with new query strings.
Otherwise, you may simply call execute again on a query object to reissue the last set of queries.

briefdescription.para: Get the results object for the query that has executed.

detaileddescription.para: Don't get this object unless you know the query has completed executing.

briefdescription.para: [DEPRECATED]
Get the last error on the query that has executed.

detaileddescription.para: Don't call this method unless you know the query has completed executing.

simplesect.para: The error code, or 0 if no error

briefdescription.para: Set the last error on the query.

detaileddescription.para: The database engine calls this. Don't.

parameterdescription.para: The error code to insert

briefdescription.para: Execute the queries enqueued in the object.

simplesect.para: The error value if synchronous, or 0 if async

briefdescription.para: Wait until the query has finished executing asynchronously.

detaileddescription.para: If the query is not executing, this immediately returns.

briefdescription.para: Add a sbIDatabaseQueryCallback instance to the query.

parameterdescription.para: The callback instance

briefdescription.para: Remove a sbIDatabaseQueryCallback instance from the query.

parameterdescription.para: The callback instance

briefdescription.para: Return whether or not the query is currently executing.
Return the current index in the queue being indexed.
Abort a currently executing query.

detaileddescription.para: This method blocks until the query has aborted

simplesect.para: True, if the query was executing and aborted (false if not executing)

memberdef.argsstring: (in unsigned long aParamIndex, in AUTF8String aValue)
memberdef.name: bindUTF8StringParameter

briefdescription.para: Binds a UTF8String to the last added query.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter to bind
Value to bind to the specified index

memberdef.argsstring: (in unsigned long aParamIndex, in AString aValue)
memberdef.name: bindStringParameter

briefdescription.para: Binds a String to the last added query.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter to bind
Value to bind to the specified index

memberdef.argsstring: (in unsigned long aParamIndex, in double aValue)
memberdef.name: bindDoubleParameter

briefdescription.para: Binds a double to the last added query.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter to bind
Value to bind to the specified index

memberdef.name: bindInt32Parameter

briefdescription.para: Binds an int32 to the last added query.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter to bind
Value to bind to the specified index

memberdef.argsstring: (in unsigned long aParamIndex, in long long aValue)
memberdef.name: bindInt64Parameter

briefdescription.para: Binds an int64 to the last added query.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter to bind
Value to bind to the specified index

briefdescription.para: Binds a null to the last added query.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter to bind

briefdescription.para: Set a specific folder/directory URI for the database.

detaileddescription.para: Set a specific folder URI where you wish your database to reside. For example, you could set the location to be the following: 'file:///C:/MyDB/'
Note that the directory is not created for you and must exist by the time execute() is called on the query.

briefdescription.para: Use selective persistent query update scheme.

detaileddescription.para: If this is enabled, a persistent query will only get re-executed when data is inserted, deleted or updated in such a way that it affects the result of the persistent query.
This disabled by default.
A persistent query would use persistExecOnInsert to dictate whether it wishes to be re-executed when data is inserted.
This is enabled by default but requires that persistExecSelectiveMode be enabled for it to be taken into account.
A persistent query would use persistExecOnUpdate to dictate whether it wishes to be re-executed when data in it's selection set is updated.
This is enabled by default but requires that persistExecSelectiveMode be enabled for it to be taken into account.
A persistent query would use persistExecOnDelete to dictate whether it wishes to be re-executed when data is deleted.
This is enabled by default but requires that persistExecSelectiveMode be enabled for it to be taken into account.

briefdescription.para: Set the rolling limit for this query.

detaileddescription.para: If set, this query will be a rolling limit query. Rather than return the full result of the query, a rolling limit query will add up the values of the column specified in rollingLimitColumnIndex and stop running once the limit set in rollingLimit is reached. The query result will be a single row containing the row that met or exceeded the limit. The row number of this row will be set in rollingLimitResult. If the limit is not reach, no rows are returned.

briefdescription.para: The index of the column used to add to the limit total.
The number of the row (1 is the first row) that met or exceeded the limit.
An object responsible for executing SQL queries on the database.

detaileddescription.para: The sbIDatabaseQuery object is used to execute queries on the underlying databases that store library and playlist data.

While client code running from chrome is free to query the databases directly, this object is more commonly passed to the database helper objects (sbIMediaLibrary, sbIPlaylistManager) that translate their methods into SQL queries placed into the passed sbIDatabaseQuery instance.
The basic loop for using a query is as follows:
1) Object Initialization - setDatabaseGUID(), optionally setAsyncQuery(), setPersistentQuery(), set callbacks, etc
2) Query Construction - addQuery(), or calls to the helper objects
3) Execution - execute(), optionally waitForCompletion()
4) Get Results - getResultObject()
5) Reset - optionally resetQuery(), if you're going to reuse the object with a new set of query strings

Multiple queries may be added to the object via multiple calls to addQuery, or multiple calls to the helper interfaces. The queries will execute sequentially and the result object will be for the last query executed.
